Why did we call it AlmaLinux OS?: Why did we call it AlmaLinux OS?
Alma means soul in Spanish and other Lat: Alma means soul in Spanish and other Latin languages. Looking back, it is easy to see that Linux is as popular and pervasive as it is thanks to the efforts of a passionate, diverse developer community. This community is the soul of Linux, and everyone that relies on a Linux distribution is indebted to the efforts of the Linux community. That is why we called our new distribution AlmaLinux OS.

AlmaLinux Software Bill of Materials (SB: AlmaLinux Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) Information
AlmaLinux provides a Software Bill of Ma: AlmaLinux provides a Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for its releases.
SBOM, which stands for Software Bill of: SBOM, which stands for Software Bill of Materials, is something akin to an “ingredient list” for a codebase.
It helps identify the contents of softwa: It helps identify the contents of software, including what open source and third-party components are used, licensing information, components' versions and if there are any known vulnerabilities in those components.
The SBOM is the “ingredient list”, the c: The SBOM is the “ingredient list”, the code are the ingredients, the build system is the “kitchen” where those ingredients get built into the final piece of software which you consume.
Open source software is used extensively: Open source software is used extensively in applications, but it has led to the discovery of high-profile hacks and vulnerabilities.
SBOMs are meant to provide the community: SBOMs are meant to provide the community and users of open source with even more transparency, and an efficient way to identify (in the case of a risk) individual files, libraries, dependencies, etc. thereby increasing the trust and confidence in the use of open source software.
The Linux Foundation and Open Source Sec: The Linux Foundation and Open Source Security Foundation (OpenSSF) have also produced a plan called the
which calls for industry action to devel: which calls for industry action to develop software component frameworks, including SBOMs, to expedite discovery of and response to future vulnerabilities like Log4j.
An SBOM has been spotlighted as a key pa: An SBOM has been spotlighted as a key part of the solution presented by the president in the
has implemented SBOM into the pipeline f: has implemented SBOM into the pipeline for the reasons listed above, to enable:
Tracing the whole build process from pul: Tracing the whole build process from pulling sources from CentOS git repositories to releasing a verified and signed package in the public repository
Making the build pipeline more secure li: Making the build pipeline more secure like ensuring that only trusted sources are used for builds, avoiding attack consequences, etc
Reducing the number of ways of data corr: Reducing the number of ways of data corruption
AlmaLinux is leveraging Codenotary’s ope: AlmaLinux is leveraging Codenotary’s open source
to provide administrators with authentic: to provide administrators with authentication, verification and full SBOM visibility.
The AlmaLinux Build System stores SBOM d: The AlmaLinux Build System stores SBOM data inside of immudb
, the standard for open source for immut: , the standard for open source for immutable databases, used by some of the world’s leading companies and governments.
All attestation data is integrity-checke: All attestation data is integrity-checked and cryptographically verified by clients.
No one can change this data, not AlmaLin: No one can change this data, not AlmaLinux or anyone else.
immudb is also protected against MITM at: immudb is also protected against MITM attacks.
The encryption key is client-side verifi: The encryption key is client-side verified and checked before every communication.

The conducted tests ensure that AMD Ryze: The conducted tests ensure that AMD Ryzen™ 3000 and 5000 series CPUs and, generally for any servers based on Ryzen processors, AlmaLinux OS work properly guaranteeing stability, security, and high performance.

The main objective of the hardware detec: The main objective of the hardware detection test is to ensure the target hardware is properly detected by
The test is performed to verify that the: The test is performed to verify that the CPU can handle a sustained high load for a period of time.
The containerization test verifies the a: The containerization test verifies the ability of the system to run processes with isolation inside containers like Docker, Podman, etc.
The test is designed to check the possib: The test is designed to check the possibility of running virtual machines with help of the KVM on the server.
The test verifies that the network adapt: The test verifies that the network adapter is working smoothly at the advertised speed load for a period of time.
The LTP testsuite contains a collection: The LTP testsuite contains a collection of tools for testing the Linux kernel and related features.
The USB test covers USB ports from a bas: The USB test covers USB ports from a basic functionality standpoint, ensuring that all ports can be accessed by the OS.
The PXE test covers the PXE device check: The PXE test covers the PXE device checks and its ability to boot OS over the network.

AlmaLinux OS Foundation signs all of its: AlmaLinux OS Foundation signs all of its software packages using a GPG signature key, which is verified by default when installing packages via dnf or graphical update tools. If a package is not signed or has an invalid signature, dnf or graphical update tools will warn the user and will refuse to install it.
It’s recommended to verify the signature: It’s recommended to verify the signature of a package before you install it.
To receive security updates and errata,: To receive security updates and errata, users can sign up for the
Subscribing to the list will allow users: Subscribing to the list will allow users to stay informed and updated on any security fixes as soon as they are available.
The Security Content Automation Protocol: The Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) automates vulnerability management, measurement, and policy compliance evaluation of systems. AlmaLinux OS offers an OpenSCAP Guide that instructs on how to use the OpenSCAP and SCAP Workbench to audit your AlmaLinux system security compliance.
AlmaLinux OS also has the availability o: AlmaLinux OS also has the availability of the CIS Benchmark.
The Open Vulnerability and Assessment La: The Open Vulnerability and Assessment Language (OVAL), offers publicly accessible security information. This includes AlmaLinux OS 8 and 9, which have available public OVAL streams.
You can find more about OVAL Streams on: You can find more about OVAL Streams on the
The Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) pr: The Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) provides a comprehensive list of third-party and open-source components in a codebase, including version numbers, licensing information, and potential vulnerabilities.
AlmaLinux Build System has implemented S: AlmaLinux Build System has implemented SBOM into its pipeline for security purposes, such as tracing the build process, making it more secure, and reducing the risk of data corruption.
AlmaLinux OS provides a set of security: AlmaLinux OS provides a set of security features: Errata, GPG keys, Mailing Lists, OpenSCAP, OVAL, SBOM, and Secure Boot

Building AlmaLinux OS without RHEL sourc: Building AlmaLinux OS without RHEL sources code
Abstract: AlmaLinux OS has historically: Abstract: AlmaLinux OS has historically been built to be an exact copy of RHEL, using RHEL's provided resources. With RedHat's shift away from sharing the full building blocks on git.centos.org, the AlmaLinux team has been hard at work to find a new, reliable path forward. Come hear about what we've been doing since June, and what we're planning for the future.
Find us right outside Ballroom B, and wh: Find us right outside Ballroom B, and while you’re there grab some stickers and swag, and sign up for your free t-shirt for AlmaLinux merch at
If you can't swing by the booth, find us: If you can't swing by the booth, find us online!
An Open Source, community owned and gove: An Open Source, community owned and governed, forever-free enterprise Linux distribution, focused on long-term stability, providing a robust production-grade platform. AlmaLinux OS is binary compatible with RHEL®.
AlmaLinux OS is an open-source, communit: AlmaLinux OS is an open-source, community-driven Linux operating system that fills the gap left by the discontinuation of the CentOS Linux stable release. AlmaLinux OS is an Enterprise Linux distro, binary compatible with RHEL®, and guided and built by the community.
The initial backers and supporters for A: The initial backers and supporters for AlmaLinux OS were already extremely active in the enterprise Linux ecosystem, and had significant experience with RHEL forks. They knew the impact that the loss of CentOS Linux would have across all industries, and had the means and knowledge to help.

Individuals and organizations that requi: Individuals and organizations that require an enterprise-grade linux distribution, without the need for a commercial license agreement. AlmaLinux OS is also a perfect replacement for anyone who has historically relied on the CentOS Linux releases to achieve computing objectives, and for whom CentOS Stream is not the right solution.
The AlmaLinux OS Foundation is a 501(c)(: The AlmaLinux OS Foundation is a 501(c)(6) that was founded in March of 2021 to own and manage the AlmaLinux OS project. We have been involving the community since the beginning, and the governing board is chosen by members of the foundation. At all times, AlmaLinux OS will be free and open.

The AlmaLinux OS Foundation has committe: The AlmaLinux OS Foundation has committed to supporting AlmaLinux OS 8.x until 2029, and AlmaLinux 9.x until 2032. This includes stable and thoroughly tested updates and security patches.

(developed and maintained by the AlmaLi: (developed and maintained by the AlmaLinux Community) allows you to migrate to, and upgrade AlmaLinux in-place.
that we were shifting our goal from bei: that we were shifting our goal from being a downstream rebuild of RHEL to maintaining ABI compatibility with RHEL. For the AlmaLinux team that means that everything from software applications to kernel modules that work on RHEL will work on AlmaLinux, and if they don't we would consider that a bug.

AlmaLinux Day Tokyo 2023 is the world's: AlmaLinux Day Tokyo 2023 is the world's first official AlmaLinux OS Foundation event. This event will be a gathering of some of the most engaged people in the AlmaLinux community, as well as technology partners from all over the world. This is the best place to engage and meet some of the people who care most about the success of AlmaLinux.

Secure Boot is a security feature that e: Secure Boot is a security feature that ensures a system boots only with trusted software, preventing the loading of unauthorized operating systems or software that could potentially compromise the system's integrity.
AlmaLinux provides Secure Boot support s: AlmaLinux provides Secure Boot support starting with the AlmaLinux 8.4 release.
AlmaLinux OS provides a set of security: AlmaLinux OS provides a set of security features: Errata, GPG keys, Mailing Lists, OpenSCAP, OVAL, SBOM

AlmaLinux Day: Germany was one of the be: AlmaLinux Day: Germany was one of the best events I've ever had. With nearly 300 attendees adjacent to one of my favorite annual events, we got to connect with people all week who were excited about AlmaLinux. I can't wait to do this again!

ALESCo acts as the central meeting point: ALESCo acts as the central meeting point for collaboration between everyone working on anything related to the AlmaLinux Project. By having open discussions and inviting viewpoints from everyone that touches AlmaLinux, we ensure AlmaLinux continues to serve its community.
Dubbed “air traffic control” for all eng: Dubbed “air traffic control” for all engineering matters, ALESCo will ensure AlmaLinux’s robustness, reliability, and sustainability while working collaboratively with and overseeing technical decisions in relevant Special Interest Groups (SIGs). The committee will hold five key responsibilities:
Technical oversight for the operating sy: Technical oversight for the operating system
